text: Sorry for the late reply. Yeah! I'm focusing on my character animation in 3D. Trying to focus on my key poses to make them strong and make them stand out. Is there any advice you could give for a beginner character animator trying to improve?

Well, maybe one of the best advise that I could tell you, is that try to work close with a reference. I think that have a good reference to match (or not) will give you a good understanding of what you need. If you are doing vfx, for sure you need a reference. But even in feature, if you check the demo reel of the greatest animators, you can see that almost everyone have a reference to work in their shots. Would you prefer to go to Feature or vfx?

Thank you. I've been trying to use references a lot more for my animatics to give me a sense of timing and movement. Also I looked at feature films  to go into because the pipeline looks interesting but I am looking at both as potential career paths. Could you tell me about what the work is like in vfx animation in comparison to a feature film ?

That's a long question to answer! but i'll do it shorty :slightly_smiling_face:
It's easy to see the exciting things about feature. But vfx has his owns.
-The first one and more important is that depends in which project you land. Probably is more boring to clean mocap for a Superheroes movie, than do for exemple Paddington, or Christopher Robin. Now there's a lot of vfx shows that has a little of "feature" style, that's the reason what I'm here :slightly_smiling_face:
-There much much work, and job opportunities on vfx, due the amoung of movies that need vfx every years.
-And maybe the most interesting to you,  usually the vfx companies are happy to hire beginners.
-And the last one (that maybe don't interest you) here in Uk there more vfx companies than feature, a lot more.
Feature is awesome... I did it for a few years
But vfx is not that bad! Actually I really like it :slightly_smiling_face:

Thats amazing, thank you so much :slightly_smiling_face:  This has really opened my eyes to working in vfx's and not just film or games. The funny thing is I enjoy the mocap cleanup :smile: What kind of work in vfx's are you doing? (If you are allowed to say).
Enjoy the mocap clean up is a really unique skill :smile: !!!  ILM should be nive for you. Everything there is based on Mocap :slightly_smiling_face:
Now I'm at Framestore doing character animation in Detective Pikachu
Thats awesome!! I saw the trailer for Detective Pikachu and it looks amazing!! :slightly_smiling_face:

I really need to do Keyframe... Actually, they put me on Avergers 4 after Christopher Robin. And I refused and asked to go to Pokemon. Obviously Avengers will awesome, but my first choices are always related about "if I'll have fun or not"  Even if the movies that I do are "shit" :sweat_smile:
Is quite fun to do Detective Pikachu Though :slightly_smiling_face:
